result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

10:05 AM CO: Vlack, DAR: Gross, Clerk: K Kittel. Defendant Amber Annella Oium not in court.  Attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for State of Wisconsin. INCLUDES:  18CF422, 18CM461, 22CF270. Court notes that DE did not appear in Branch III today for her 9:30 hearings. DA Anderson asks for body only warrants. Court ISSUES Body only warrants, adjoining states only on 18CF422 and 22CF270, Body Only, Statewide on 18CM461.  Adjourned: 10:09 am.
PD office reached out to JA on this date to say they are having difficulty locating Defendant an attorney. RJG

11:45 AM Court Commissioner: Tim Heckmann, Reporter: Unmonitored DAR, Clerk: Benoy  Defendant Amber Annella Oium in court.  Attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court confirms address.  DE believes she would qualify for a PD.  Court notes STC's set on underlying cases on 8/19/22.  Court will set on that date also.  DF should call the PD office.  Court finds good cause to continue the Preliminary Hearing.  Atty Ballo updates the court as to missed tests and positive test today.  Requests to modify bond to an additional $500 cash.  Court maintains bond as is for today as DE does not have an Atty.  There will be one more random test before the next hearing.  Adjourned:  11:53  OFF Record:  there is a STC set with EFV 8/19/22 @ 9:45 on this file.  STC with SRN will not be set on this case.  DF provided with a copy of the NOH.
22R 010630.  Posted by B. Kvaal. bph
Per TCH. Fax: SCSO, Dispatch, Jail.  gll

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to submit to random drug testing at least ONE time per week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.
